answers.answer: It seems very unlikely that this is a brain tumor, especially since you had a negative CT of the head.  Really, I would think there's practically no chance of a brain tumor.  If two or three different doctors thought you had an ear/sinus infection, then that's almost certainly what is going on.  I would address it on that basis, but maybe they need to culture what is in your ear, if there's something that they can reach and get a sample of, to culture it.  Good luck.

My mom had a horrible ear infection that kept getting worse, to the point it hospitalized her for a week.The problem ended up being the doctor didn't read the notes saying she was diabetic and he gave her the wrong antibiotics.Any chance of a similar problem since the infection seems very stubborn?
The infection finally went away after 3 rounds of antibiotics but I was tested for autoimmune diseases and some of my levels were elevated . So I know diabetes is an autoimmune disease

question: Hello im new to this for almost 2 months now I have been experiencing pain in the back of the head along with burning on top of my head I went to the er a month ago and was told it was a ear infection and was given a zpack the pain and burning continued so I went again I was given a ct of the head it was normal but the pain was still going on so I seen my family doctor who said the ear infection was very severe and gave me another round of antibiotics took them started to feel a little better went to the er again 2 days ago will same problems said the ear infection was still yhere on another round of antibiotics he also said sinus issues . Does this all sound right ? Is all the head pain and burning caused by this I am still very very scared .Has anyone had this happen ?
title: Brain tumor?  Please help
